column1:
Title: Summary comparison - correctness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A (Score 2)
column2:
Title: Summary comparison - correctness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary includes less false information. False information includes inaccuracies, omissions, or misrepresentations of the reference text.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A (Score: 2)
column3:
Title: Summary comparison - accuracy policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary accurately represents the reference text.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary accurately represents the reference text. Accuracy is determined by the extent to which the summary captures the key findings and interpretations of the reference text without significant inaccuracies, omissions, or misrepresentations.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A (Score: 2)

Note: Accuracy is based on the faithful representation of the reference text without introducing false information, inaccuracies, omissions, or misrepresentations.
column4:

Accuracy is determined by the extent to which the summary captures the key findings and interpretations of the reference text without significant inaccuracies, omissions, or misrepresentations.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A (Score: 2)

Note: Accuracy is based on the faithful representation of the reference text without introducing false information, inaccuracies, omissions, or misrepresentations. If there is uncertainty about the accuracy of a summary, it is recommended to provide a score of 0.

Additional Note: In cases where both summaries accurately capture the key findings and interpretations without significant inaccuracies, omissions, or misrepresentations, it is important to provide a score of 0 to indicate that neither summary is better than the other in terms of accuracy.
